Dear Ms. Ahart:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry.
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member provided their brother's contact information, to a
youth at the IL house, for the purpose of engaging in a
relationship.
Investigation On 3/12/24 Complainant reported to DCWL that Staff 1 provided
her brother’s contact information to Youth A (age 17), so they
could start a relationship. The brother’s name and age were
unknown. It was unknown if Youth A and the brother
communicated or had any physical contact. On 4/3/24 additional
information was reported in a second intake. The intake stated
that Youth A and Staff 1 were in an argument at the facility, in
which Youth A referenced having sex with Staff 1’s brother. Staff 1
left the facility, quitting her job.
On 3/13/24 DHHS Worker emailed DCWL and the agency’s Chief
Administrator regarding the allegations and safety plan.
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 3/13/24.
Complainant indicated she received the information while working
at another child caring organization. One of the youth in her
program reported they heard Youth A bragging at school about
how Staff 1 hooked her up with her brother. No name or age was
provided for the brother. Youth A reportedly told friends at school
that she asked Staff 1 for her brother’s phone number, and Staff 1
provided it. Complainant stated she did not know if Youth A had
any contact with Staff 1’s brother. Complainant was concerned
about the possibility of sex trafficking.
Program Manager was interviewed via Teams on 3/14/24.
Program Manager stated she was informed of the allegation and
spoke with Youth A and Staff 1 as part of the safety plan
requested by DHHS Worker. When Program Manager spoke with
2

Staff 1, she denied the allegation and stated she never shared any
of her sibling’s information with any youth in the program. Staff 1
reported having one 16-year-old brother and two adult brothers.
Staff 1 reported her 16-year-old brother did not know Youth A or
have any reason to talk to her.
Program Manager reported Youth A also denied having contact
with any siblings of Staff 1. Youth A stated she was not close with
Staff 1 and did not talk with Staff 1 about their personal lives.
Youth A denied telling anyone at school that she had contact with
Staff 1’s brother.
After Program Manager spoke with Youth A about the allegation,
Youth A stated she did not want to talk to anyone else about it and
indicated she would not cooperate with interviews. Youth A then
went AWOL. Youth A reportedly stated she would be back in three
days, but her whereabouts were unknown. Youth A returned to the
program on 3/16/24.
A follow-up call occurred via Teams on 4/11/24 to discuss the
additional information from 4/3/24. Program Manager reported the
information was provided to Law Enforcement. However, an
officer was not yet assigned. Program Manager stated Staff 1 was
terminated from employment. Staff 1 was not interviewed as she
left the agency immediately following the verbal argument with
Youth A on 4/2/24. Youth A did not provide additional information
to Program Manager about the allegations. Youth A went AWOL
again on 4/5/24 and has not returned.
Case Manager was contacted via Teams on 4/11/24. Case
Manager reported she had communication with Youth A on 4/9/24.
Youth A reported she would return to the program by curfew that
night. Youth A did not return. Case Manager has since been
unsuccessful in attempts to contact Youth A. Case Manager
reported speaking with Youth A briefly before she went AWOL.
Youth A did not provide the name of Staff 1’s brother or share any
information about what may have happened. However, Youth A
did indicate the brother was 17 or 18 years old.
Staff 1 was interviewed by phone on 3/25/24. Staff 1 adamantly
denied the allegation, stating she would never do anything like
that. Staff 1 has worked in child welfare for several years and
does not want to jeopardize her career. Staff 1 stated she had
three brothers ages 28, 18, and 16. Staff 1 stated the older two
would have no reason to know Youth A. The 16-year-old brother
did not know Youth A or attend her school. Staff 1 stated she
3

would never try to connect her brother with any of the residents.
Staff 1 reported Youth A had been going through some difficult
times lately and has been non-compliant with the program. It is
unknown if Youth A would make such statements at school for
attention from her peers, or if the peer made up the claim.
After the additional information was received by DCWL on 4/3/24,
attempts were made to contact Staff 1 on 4/8/24 and 4/11/24 for a
second interview. Staff 1 did not respond.
Attempts were made to contact Youth A by phone and text on
3/25/24, 3/27/24 and 4/2/24. However, Youth A did not respond to
requests for an interview. Youth A went AWOL on 4/5/24 and
remained on that status as of 5/13/24.
Attempts were made to contact Law Enforcement by phone
on 4/28/24, 5/2/24, 5/8/24, and 5/13/24. No response was
received regarding the status of their investigation.
Documents:
• The employment file for Staff 1 did not contain any prior
disciplinary action regarding boundaries with youth.
• The agency does not specifically have a policy regarding
boundaries with youth. However, staff are provided with the
National Association of Social Workers Code of Ethics
during orientation. The expectation is for staff to follow this
code. This document was signed by Staff 1 on 12/8/2022.
Analysis As Staff 1 denied the allegations, Youth A refused to be
interviewed, and there was no evidence of the alleged incident
occurring, no violation was found.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
_ _______________May 21, 2024______________________
Heather Reilly Date
